intro: Codarium nitidum, commonly known as the smooth codary, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
